A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I loved it!

Fuck all the haters.

It is a real war movie that shows grit and complexity of war and the human condition. Luke has a very sober look at the entire saga. All the complaints of TFA were addressed by Snoke and Luke. It was a roller coaster.

The soundtrack was great. I wish there was a callback to "battle duel of heroes" song when Luke fought Kylo.

It was perfect and I didn't know where it was going.

NOBODY SHOULD BE SURPRISED AT THE MOOD AND THEME AFTER SEEING ROGUE ONE. IT ISNT LIGHT HEARTED LIKE THE PREQUELS. ITS WAR.
It's great. There are a lot of complexities to war. I also loved how many emotions and love towards animals there were.

Definitely #3\, maybe even #2\, favorite StarWars movie.

Things I want to see in future StarWars films:

a spy\, unknown to us until the third act\, among the First Order or the Resistance.

people that fight for the Resistance for their own gain. For selfish reasons.

I loved the mutiny. Poe Dameron\, General Hux and Kylo stole the show. I want to see more of Kylo. He's the Anakin we didn't get in the prequels (because of writing not because of acting. There were amazing actors in the prequels\, it was all directing and writing that was bad).

I want to see General Hux and Kylo team lead the First Order. Hux being reasonable and holding back kylo\, Kylo being raw strength and power. It's great.
I loved seeing Captain Phasma as a human before she "died."

10/10\, I loved it as a war movie. Then again my favorite movies/shows are : Fury\, The Dark Knight\, and Band of Brothers.
